data.name: Your first use of ast: Inspecting Python Functions
data.description:
## AST Series:
+ Your first use of ast: Inspecting Python Functions (this one!) + [AST Series #2: Your First NodeTransformer](https://www.codewars.com/kata/64dbb4ab529cad81578c61e7) + [AST Series #3: The Missing Link](https://www.codewars.com/kata/64dd031d9a9b8c1bc6972e9f) # Preamble The ast module provides functions to parse Python source code and convert it into an abstract syntax tree. This AST representation allows you to analyze, manipulate, and transform Python code programmatically. It is particularly useful in scenarios where you need to perform static analysis, code generation, or code modification. # Task Your task is to write a function `describe_fn` to inspect a python function when given its source `source`, and return information about it. # Instructions You will write a function `describe_fn` taking a function's source code `source` as input, and will use Python's [AST](https://docs.python.org/3/library/ast.html) to grab information about it.
`describe_fn` will return a `dict`: `{`
`'name': `
`'argument_names': ,`
`'statement_count': `
`}` # Extras All inputs will be valid functions. # Constraints `exec` and `eval` are disabled. Importing from `inspect` is considered cheating and will fail (inspect katas coming soon?).
